ARTICLE.TITLE: CIT ROBBER ARRESTED FOR KILLING A COP!
ARTICLE.TEXT:
A 38-year-old suspect was arrested in Rustenburg on Monday for killing a police officer.

This comes after Special Task Force members engaged an armed gang around Mahikeng, who were in three vehicles.

“The suspects were confronted as they blew open the van and they retaliated and took off in different directions. In their attempt to escape, two of the vehicles faced off with members from TOMS,” Brigadier Hangwani Mulaudzi said.

Unfortunately, during the shootout, Detective Warrant Officer Delene Grobelaar (44) was fatally shot.A manhunt was launched after the suspects fled the scene.Later in the day, one suspect was tracked and arrested at a Johannesburg hospital.

“A follow-up operation was launched in Coligny, where the wanted suspects were confronted at a filling station. They retaliated with AK 47 rifles, fatally wounding Detective Warrant Officer Wynand Herbst,” Brigadier Mulaudzi added.

During the shootout, three suspects were fatally wounded and two wounded suspects were arrested at the crime scene.

“The latest arrest brings to eight the number of suspects that have been arrested thus far. Out of the eight, three were fatally wounded, whilst five are behind bars including the latest suspect,” Brigadier Mulaudzi said.

The suspect is expected to appear at the Mahikeng Magistrate Court on Wednesday.

Meanwhile, four suspects are expected to appear on 24 April 2020 on charges of murder, attempted murder, possession of illegal firearms and ammunition and attempted robbery with aggravating circumstances (CIT).
